title: File provisioner in windows guests: 'missing the terminator: "' when destination contains spaces
body:
### Description
If there is a space in a file's destination path of a file provisioner running on Windows, the provisioner fails with error when creating the destination file's parent directory.

Seems like a problem with proper quoting of spaces in filesystem paths.

### Vagrant version
Vagrant 2.0.1

### Host operating system
macOS 10.13.2 (17C205)

### Guest operating system
Windows 7 Pro SP1 FPP Czech

### Vagrantfile
```ruby
Vagrant.configure(2) do |config|
  # ...
  config.vm.define 'win' do |win|
    win.vm.box = "some/win7prosp1box"
    # ...
    win.vm.provision 'file', source: 'vagrant/firefox-autoconfig.js', destination: 'C:/Program Files/Mozilla Firefox/browser/defaults/preferences/autoconfig.js'
    # ...
  end
end
```

### Debug output
https://gist.github.com/dusek/a2a77f9ecff823f194496709ba0a8d9f

### Expected behavior
- the `vagrant up` command would not error
- the file on host at `vagrant/firefox-autoconfig.js` would be uploaded on guest at `C:/Program Files/Mozilla Firefox/browser/defaults/preferences/autoconfig.js`.

### Actual behavior
- the `vagrant up` command errors with:
```
...
mkdir Firefox/browser/defaults/preferences" -force
...
The string starting:
+ mkdir Firefox/browser/defaults/preferences <<<< " -force
is missing the terminator: ".
```
- the file on guest at `C:/Program Files/Mozilla Firefox/browser/defaults/preferences/autoconfig.js` does not exist

### Steps to reproduce
1. Run `vagrant up win --provision-with file` with the above Vagrantfile (or when the machine is alread created, run `vagrant provision win --provision-with file`, i.e. for repeated testing of Vagrantfile changes)

### Notes
- Tried escaping the path with one, two, three and four `\` characters, to no avail.
- Tried placing the `^` character before the space, to no avail.
- Tried changing the destination path to add another non-existent directory `A B`, i.e. `C:/Program Files/A B/Mozilla Firefox/browser/defaults/preferences/autoconfig.js`. This led to the exact same "point of path split", i.e. the error message referred to the same failing command `mkdir Firefox/browser/defaults/preferences" -force`

### References
- GH-7234
